parseMessage

public static boolean parseMessage(byte[] header,
                                   int socketId)
Reads information about an incoming descriptor header, parses the bytes into the right object, and sends it on. Enforces with no mercy.
Parameters:
header - a 23 byte decriptor header candidate.
socketId - the socket from which the header came.
Returns:
true on success

deliver

public static boolean deliver(MessageObject object)
This extracts the socketId from the object, and sends it to the larger Deliver
Parameters:
object - The object to deliver
Returns:
true on success

deliver

public static boolean deliver(MessageObject object,
                              int sock)
Deliver is the reverse of parseMessage. It takes an object, converts it to bytes, and sends it on.
Parameters:
object - The object to deliver
sock - The socketId to deliver to
Returns:
true on success
